quest.name: Set Faezahr to Stun
journal: Forgemaster Brithael has had to take on more smithing than he can anvil.

Brithael's love of drink has caught up with him, as he appears to be suffering from a prolonged hangover. Unfortunately, this means that he is in no condition to fill Faezahr's latest commission. Offer your services to the merchant on behalf of the forgemaster.

The steel bhuj Faezahr seeks to have forged is intended as a present for his favorite axeman, and he will accept nothing less than the finest quality. Craft the item to the best of your ability and present it to Faezahr for inspection.

Your bhuj elicits an uncharacteristic expression of bloodlust from Faezahr, though he manages to quickly regain his composure. Once again impressed with your fine display of craftsmanship, the merchant hints that he will have more work for you in future.

※The next blacksmith quest will be available from Brithael upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Deliver a steel bhuj to Faezahr.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Ugh... Somethin' evil's brewin' in me belly, I tell ye. Can't seem to─hurk─keep anythin' down. Too many at the Wench, I reckon.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Couldn't have come at a worse time either, with Faezahr breathin' down me neck...

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Now when it comes to the market, ye've never met a tighter miser than ol' Faezahr, but at the Coliseum, the man throws gold at fighters like water at a fire.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: They know it, too! So they ask their patron fer a new blade. An' once they get their blade, now it's a bigger, sharper, shinier blade. Before you know it, I'm wastin' me wakin' bells forgin' weapons fer folk what ain't got arms enough to wield 'em all!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Don't get me wrong─I'd gladly take the whoreson's coin. But I ain't up to it this time, on account o' me condition.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Which is why I need ye to make whatever needs makin' in me stead. Have a word with Faezahr an' see what he wants.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: So, Brithael sends you to me yet again? I am flattered he holds me in such esteem.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: As you may have heard, I have an eye for able warriors. Yet without the proper arms and armaments, ability is for naught.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Forge me one steel bhuj of equal parts splendor and might, and you and Brithael shall know the bounty of my generosity.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: But fail me, Forename, and I may be forced to reconsider my arrangement with Naldiq & Vymelli's.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: One steel bhuj, Forename. Make the greatest weapon you've ever made, then throw it away and make me a better one!

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: You've come with my gift? Excellent. Let us have a look, shall we?

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I demanded nothing short of perfection, and you have exceeded my every expectation, Forename. A finer bhuj I have never seen.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: A well-wrought oak haft with a solid steel blade, more than sharp enough to slice through sinew and bone.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Many an aurochs' neck shall it cleave. I cannot wait to see it wielded.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Yes, the glory of the steel bhuj you have forged for me shall be sung in the screams of all who stand before it!

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Ahem. I see my trust in you was not misplaced, Forename. And I trust I shall have need of your skills in the future.
